about-me.address:
Home: 1036 Hemlock Lane, Enola, Pennsylvania 17025
School: 525 East 2nd St., Room 328 Luzerne Hall, Bloomsburg, Pennsylvania 17815

education.study: B.S. in Computer Science | Cum. GPA: 3.53
list-items: Received the Henry Carver Math, Science, and Technology Scholarship awarded to promising students in the College of Science and Technology.
Won the November 2016 Department of Mathematics and Digital Sciences Problem Solving Competition.
Honors program: Performed 16 hours of community service, landscaping and cleaning up for a local daycare, as well as cooking and serving meals for the Catholic Campus Ministry.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
list-items: Developed a distributable plugin in Java to enable system engineers to track changes to UML diagram projects, synchronize these changes with their team's SharePoint sites, and notify team members of changes.
Designed and built a React web application to view and comment on the diagrams of the current state of a project, with a build process automated by Gulp.
Created tools to generate project changelogs, structure project data as JSON, and store user configurations in XML
Taught the use of web technologies and their context in software development to peers and mentors.
Led major project design overhauls to accurately meet system engineers' needs.

experience.title: Student Living and Learning Community Mentor
list-items: Supporting the academic success and wellness of freshmen in the Computer Science program.
Tutoring in lower level Computer Science and Math subjects.
Planning and organizing events for members of the Living and Learning Community.
Setting up a dedicated server for LLC-related activities including a webserver.
Building and programming GoPiGo robots with LLC members and faculty directors.
Learned from topics ranging from self-development to technologies such as AWS, webcrawlers, and the MEAN stack.
Participated in a student-led project to construct a system of GPS trackers with the purpose of building a cross-platform app to track campus shuttle buses.
Competitor for programming competition team, placed 4th at PACISE 2017.

extracurricular.organization: Bloomsburg University Department of Mathematics and Digital Sciences
list-items: Provided tutorial services for 3-4 hours a week in freshmen-level Computer Science and Math courses.
